tokens.text: analyzes pack file sizes and counts against platform limits

title: Pack Size
description: Analyzes pack file sizes and counts to ensure content fits within platform limits. Large packs can cause download issues and slow loading times on mobile devices.

fields.title: Total Size
fields.description: Total size in bytes of all files in the pack, including non-content files.
fields.technicalDescription: Data contains the size in bytes as a number

fields.title: File Count
fields.description: Total number of files in the pack.
fields.technicalDescription: Data contains the file count as a number

fields.title: Folder Count
fields.description: Total number of folders in the pack.
fields.technicalDescription: Data contains the folder count as a number

fields.title: Content Size
fields.description: Total size in bytes of content files only (JSON, images, sounds, etc.), excluding system files.
fields.technicalDescription: Data contains the content size in bytes as a number

fields.title: Content Files
fields.description: Number of content files in the pack.
fields.technicalDescription: Data contains the content file count as a number

fields.title: Content Folders
fields.description: Number of content folders in the pack.
fields.technicalDescription: Data contains the content folder count as a number

fields.title: Addon Size Warning
fields.description: Warning when the add-on exceeds recommended size limits. Large add-ons may have issues on mobile platforms or with Realms uploads.
fields.howToUse: Reduce pack size by compressing textures, removing unused assets, or splitting into multiple packs. Target under 100MB for best mobile compatibility.
fields.technicalDescription: Data contains the size that exceeds the limit

fields.title: Package Size Warning
fields.description: Warning when the packaged content (.mcaddon/.mcpack) exceeds recommended size limits for distribution.
fields.howToUse: Compress textures to reduce file size, use lower resolution for mobile targets, and remove any development/debug files before packaging.
fields.technicalDescription: Data contains the package size that exceeds the limit

fields.title: Zip Processing Error
fields.description: Error when a zip file within the pack could not be read or processed. May indicate corruption or unsupported compression.
fields.howToUse: The zip file may be corrupted. Try re-downloading or re-creating the zip. Ensure you're using standard ZIP compression without advanced features.
fields.technicalDescription: Data contains the path to the problematic zip file
